title: Add filtering function to the dkcl function
body:
The original dkcl function deletes all containers regardless of whether they were started by this sample or not (e.g. rancher/agent).
Doing so would corrupt the host's environment and cause inconvenience. So I added conditional filtering to the dkfc function.

title: Fix TLS envvars typo
body:
The fabric-ca TLS environment variable names for cert file and key file are incorrect:
- FABRIC_CA_SERVER_**CA**_CERTFILE
- FABRIC_CA_SERVER_**CA**_KEYFILE

I believe they should be:

- FABRIC_CA_SERVER_**TLS**_CERTFILE
- FABRIC_CA_SERVER_**TLS**_KEYFILE

like the working example from first-network:
https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric-samples/blob/f05a132586ae9ca7ce86b9e56ae4bd3b084bc959/first-network/docker-compose-e2e-template.yaml#L24-L25

This could create confusion (error) for beginners when they try to enable TLS in basic-network.

title: balance transfer: fix register response error
body: It responses empty secret value after successfully register and enroll, and the value of "enrollmentSecret" in persistence is also empty string. The added code set the "_enrollmentSecret" value of the User object and update the user context in persistence again.

title: Added user1 role to fix registration error
body:
Without the role specified in the call to the register function, an error is returned, demanding an identity type be provided in the call.
`Failed to register: Error: fabric-ca request register failed with errors [[{"code":0,"message":"No identity type provided. Please provide identity type"}]]
`
Adding `role: 'client'` in the register function call fixes this.

Signed-off-by: Kartik Shah krtk.6160@gmail.com

title: Updated the initial channel configuration and block for FAB-5309
body:
https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-5309

Was receiving this error:
```
Rejecting CONFIG_UPDATE because: Error authorizing update: Error validating DeltaSet: invalid mod_policy for element [Policy] /Channel/Application/Writers: mod_policy not set
```

When following this tutorial http://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/latest/chaincode4ade.html

To recreate the issue:
```
git pull
cd chaincode-docker-devmode
docker-compose -f docker-compose-simple.yaml up
```

Solution was to regenerate the myc.tx and orderer.block using configtxgen v1.0.1

title: byfn.sh: CURRENT_DIR issue with long paths fixed
body: Double quoted CURRENT_DIR var to allow right expansion for long paths. Before it caused a "too many arguments" for cd command

title: update to byfn.sh exec, fix bug in networkUp function
body: This is posted in StackOverflow [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/45679395/hyperledger-fabric-first-network-fails-with-bad-request/45694630#45694630). The networkUp function in byfn.sh calls docker compose twice, once prior to the ```IF_COUCHDB``` test and a second time within the scope of that if statement. The networkUp function also fails to set the DELAY argument on either of the docker-compose requests within the if statement. In this pull request, I've commented out line 113 (the duplicate docker-compose request) and added ```DELAY=$CLI_DELAY``` to each of the docker-compose statements inside the if structure. The default setting of 3 seconds is now passed correctly to docker-compose and the network up function processes correctly.

title: Error to generate Orderer Genesis block
body: Add FABRIC_CFG_PATH variable to allow configtxgen to find configuration file
